body:
- Start a minimal flutter app using the iOS simulator
- Press stop

The stop button appears depressed for multiple seconds before the UI responds, giving the appearance that the UI has hung.

comment_data.body: @lukechurch Which version of the flutter plugin are you using? How far along had the flutter process gotten before you clicked Stop? More specifically, did flutter print "Application running" to the console or was it still initializing?

@stevemessick I was running 0.1 when this occurred. yes, the app was running before I hit stop. 

I've now updated to 0.1.2 - the stop button now appears to be immediate :) however the app doesn't appear to stop, it just keeps running.

That's a bug in the daemon: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/6208

I think we can close this one.
Assigning to @mit-mit to capture in known issues before closing.

> If we do that, can we make the hover text explain why? I.e. that if the developer wants these functions, they should launch in dev mode?

üëç

@stevemessick I'm working on a fix to allow the IDE to stop an app started in release mode. We should determine the best behavior for the run and debug buttons as well - I started an issue to discuss that. I also hope to make some progress on https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/6400 as well, in terms of improving the events that flutter tools creates that an IDE could key off to know more about the state of a launch.
Please see https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/362 for a suggestion for run/debug semantics.

title: Stop button appears to hang UI
